This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"deposit(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to deposit","token":"The collateral token address"}},"depositFor(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to deposit","token":"The collateral token address","user":"The user to credit the deposit to"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"seize(address,address,uint256,address)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to seize","liquidator":"The liquidator receiving the collateral","token":"The collateral token to seize","user":"The borrower being liquidated"}},"setTimelock(address)":{"details":"Must be called *through* the current timelock (i.e. scheduled +      executed as a normal timelocked operation)."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"withdraw(address,uint256,address)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to withdraw","token":"The collateral token","user":"The user withdrawing (must be called by BorrowModule after health check)"}},"withdrawFor(address,address,uint256,address,bool)":{"details":"Only callable by contracts with LEVERAGE_VAULT_ROLENow checks health factor via BorrowModule to prevent undercollateralized withdrawals","params":{"amount":"Amount to withdraw","recipient":"Where to send the collateral","skipHealthCheck":"Set to true only during position closure (when debt is also being repaid)","token":"The collateral token","user":"The user whose collateral to withdraw"}}},"stateVariables":{"borrowModule":{"details":"BorrowModule reference for health factor checks"}},"title":"CollateralVault","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"addCollateral(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Add a new collateral token (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)"},"deposit(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Deposit collateral"},"depositFor(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Deposit collateral on behalf of another user (for LeverageVault integration)"},"disableCollateral(address)":{"notice":"Allow disabling collateral (no new deposits, existing positions can withdraw) Disabled tokens MUST remain in supportedTokens[] so that BorrowModule._weightedCollateralValue() continues to count them for health factor. Removing them made the S-C01 fix dead code, instantly liquidating users who held disabled collateral. The 50-token cap already prevents gas DoS."},"enableCollateral(address)":{"notice":"Re-enable a previously disabled collateral token Token already remains in supportedTokens[] after disable, so no push needed on re-enable. Just flip the enabled flag."},"getConfig(address)":{"notice":"Get collateral config for a token"},"getDeposit(address,address)":{"notice":"Get a user's deposit for a specific token"},"getSupportedTokens()":{"notice":"Get the list of supported collateral tokens"},"pause()":{"notice":"Pause deposits"},"seize(address,address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Seize collateral during liquidation"},"setBorrowModule(address)":{"notice":"Set borrow module (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)"},"setTimelock(address)":{"notice":"Migrate to a new timelock controller."},"timelock()":{"notice":"Address of the MintedTimelockController that gates admin ops"},"unpause()":{"notice":"Unpause deposits Require DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE for separation of duties"},"updateCollateral(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Update collateral parameters (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)"},"withdraw(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Withdraw collateral (BorrowModule checks health factor before allowing)"},"withdrawFor(address,address,uint256,address,bool)":{"notice":"Withdraw collateral on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault close position)"}},"notice":"Holds collateral deposits for the borrowing system. BorrowModule and LiquidationEngine interact with this VZyx6B4Jx7XgaQzLKHj38vJz8"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol":{"keccak256":"0x11a5a79827df29e915a12740caf62fe21ebe27c08c9ae3e09abe9ee3ba3866d3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3cf0c69ab827e3251db9ee6a50647d62c90ba580a4d7bbff21f2bea39e7b2f4a","dweb:/ipfs/QmZiKwtKU1SBX4RGfQtY7PZfiapbbu6SZ9vizGQD9UHjRA"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/introspection/ERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x2d9dc2fe26180f74c11c13663647d38e259e45f95eb88f57b61d2160b0109d3e","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://81233d1f98060113d9922180bb0f14f8335856fe9f339134b09335e9f678c377","dweb:/ipfs/QmWh6R35SarhAn4z2wH8SU456jJSYL2FgucfTFgbHJJN4E"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8891738ffe910f0cf2da09566928589bf5d63f4524dd734fd9cedbac3274dd5c","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://971f954442df5c2ef5b5ebf1eb245d7105d9fbacc7386ee5c796df1d45b21617","dweb:/ipfs/QmadRjHbkicwqwwh61raUEapaVEtaLMcYbQZWs9gUkgj3u"]}},"version":1}

params.user: The user to credit the deposit to

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setTimelock(address).details: Must be called *through* the current timelock (i.e. scheduled +      executed as a normal timelocked operation).

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

params.user: The user withdrawing (must be called by BorrowModule after health check)

withdrawFor(address,address,uint256,addr.details: Only callable by contracts with LEVERAGE_VAULT_ROLENow checks health factor via BorrowModule to prevent undercollateralized withdrawals

params.skipHealthCheck: Set to true only during position closure (when debt is also being repaid)
params.user: The user whose collateral to withdraw

addCollateral(address,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Add a new collateral token (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)

depositFor(address,address,uint256).notice: Deposit collateral on behalf of another user (for LeverageVault integration)

disableCollateral(address).notice: Allow disabling collateral (no new deposits, existing positions can withdraw) Disabled tokens MUST remain in supportedTokens[] so that BorrowModule._weightedCollateralValue() continues to count them for health factor. Removing them made the S-C01 fix dead code, instantly liquidating users who held disabled collateral. The 50-token cap already prevents gas DoS.

enableCollateral(address).notice: Re-enable a previously disabled collateral token Token already remains in supportedTokens[] after disable, so no push needed on re-enable. Just flip the enabled flag.

getConfig(address).notice: Get collateral config for a token

getDeposit(address,address).notice: Get a user's deposit for a specific token

getSupportedTokens().notice: Get the list of supported collateral tokens

setTimelock(address).notice: Migrate to a new timelock controller.

timelock().notice: Address of the MintedTimelockController that gates admin ops

unpause().notice: Unpause deposits Require DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE for separation of duties

withdraw(address,uint256,address).notice: Withdraw collateral (BorrowModule checks health factor before allowing)

withdrawFor(address,address,uint256,addr.notice: Withdraw collateral on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault close position)
